summary: Certain federal contracts that go to large businesses must have small business subcontracting plans. Under these plans, contractors have to make a good-faith effort to offer subcontracting opportunities to small businesses. Agencies are supposed to notify Small Business Administration representatives about proposed contracts with these plans for possible review. But for about half of the 26 contracts we examined, agencies couldn’t show whether that happened...
title: Small Business Subcontracting: Oversight of Contractor Compliance with Subcontracting Plans Needs Improvement
